abstract.text: A Boolean value that indicates whether this view controller’s view is covered when the view controller or one of its descendants presents a view controller.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: style to present a view controller, this property controls which existing view controller in your view controller hierarchy is actually covered by the new content. When a context-based presentation occurs, UIKit starts at the presenting view controller and walks up the view controller hierarchy. If it finds a view controller whose value for this property is
, it asks that view controller to present the new view controller. If no view controller defines the presentation context, UIKit asks the window’s root view controller to handle the presentation.
The default value for this property is
. Some system-provided view controllers, such as

abstract.text: A false value.
A true value.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
Modal presentation styles available when presenting view controllers.
A presentation style where the content is displayed over another view controller’s content.
A presentation style where the content is displayed over another view controller’s content.
Transition styles available when presenting view controllers.
A container view controller that defines a stack-based scheme for navigating hierarchical content.
An object that manages a view hierarchy for your UIKit app.
A Boolean value that indicates whether this view controller’s view is covered when the view controller or one of its descendants presents a view controller.
Returns a Boolean indicating whether the current input view is dismissed automatically when changing controls.
Dismisses the view controller that was presented modally by the view controller.
A Boolean value indicating whether the view controller enforces a modal behavior.
The presentation style for modal view controllers.
The transition style to use when presenting the view controller.
Presents a view controller modally.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the view controller specifies the transition style for view controllers it presents.
Presents a view controller in a primary context.
Posted when a split view controller is expanded or collapsed.
Presents a view controller in a secondary (or detail) context.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
